thread.title: Houston campus to increase patrols after fatal shooting
thread.title_full: Houston campus to increase patrols after fatal shooting | Albuquerque Journal News

author: Associated Press
title: Houston campus to increase patrols after fatal shooting
text:
HOUSTON – Authorities pledged increased patrols Saturday at Texas Southern University following three incidents of gunfire in less than four days, including the fatal shooting of a student.
Houston police spokeswoman Jodi Silva identified the student as 18-year-old Brent Randall, a freshman who died Friday en route to a hospital after being shot next to a student housing complex.
Another person was injured in Friday’s shooting and hospitalized. It is unclear whether that person is a TSU student.
Two men were detained, but Silva declined to say whether they’re still being held. Police are searching for a third person.
The gunfire that killed Randall was preceded hours earlier by another shooting near the same housing complex. No one was believed harmed.
On Tuesday, university police said a shooting after a poetry slam on campus injured another man.
Administrators promised more patrols by campus security and university police. Houston police will also boost patrols around the campus.
The latest shooting generated some confusion for emergency responders because the building sits on the edge of campus, away from other structures.
